intro: Aglaia lawii subsp. submonophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf aglaia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
